item.title: Ticket #3572 (IIS RTE not loading in 2.1) updated
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: You have the zlib extension installed, so ob_gzhandler() should exist. The error suggests that ob_gzhandler() is being run twice. If you have plugins activated, check to make sure none of them invoke ob_gzhandler(). Failing that, if you can edit your php.ini, try setting output_buffering to Off. It is currently 4096. I don't think that should matter since zlib.output_compression is off, but it won't hurt to check.

item.title: Ticket #3599 (Admin screens could use filtering in various places) created
item.dc:creator: jhodgdon
item.description:
Sometimes, when the Admin screens put things like post categories and post titles on the screen, they are run through filters (so plugins can modify how they are displayed). Sometimes, they are not -- it isn't consistent. Here are some places they need to be added:

1) Dashboard screen: "Latest Activity" section filters post titles in "Posts" section but not in "Comments" section.

2) Manage / Categories screen: Category names are not filtered in the list of categories, or in the note about deleting section.

3) Blogroll / Manage Blogroll, Add Blogroll, and Import screens: Link titles and categories are not filtered (see ticket [3595 #3595], where patches will be added)

This is a MUCH reduced list, as compared to version 2.0.6, by the way! Thanks!

I will attach patches to add these filters.

item.title: Ticket #3598 (query_posts produces SQL error when excluding empty category) created
item.dc:creator: joefish
item.description:
When setting up the loop with query_posts, an SQL error is generated if an empty category is excluded. For example, if the category with the id 8 is empty, query_posts('cat=-8') produces:

WordPress database error: [You have an error in your SQL syntax; check the manual that corresponds to your MySQL server version for the right syntax to use near '8 AND (post_type = 'post' AND (post_status = 'publish' OR post_status = 'private' at line 1] SELECT SQL_CALC_FOUND_ROWS wp_posts.* FROM wp_posts LEFT JOIN wp_post2cat ON (wp_posts.ID = wp_post2cat.post_id) WHERE 1=1 8 AND (post_type = 'post' AND (post_status = 'publish' OR post_status = 'private')) GROUP BY wp_posts.ID ORDER BY post_date DESC LIMIT 0, 10

item.title: Ticket #3593 (Add stable tag to SVN) closed
item.dc:creator: foolswisdom
item.description:
wontfix:

Closing as WONTFIX for now.

Thank you for participating in WordPress!

There is also ​http://svn.automattic.com/wordpress/branches/2.0 , but I appreciate that is not your point.

This was discussed in September, ​wp-hackers SVN: /branches/stable/
and it seemed that there was technical problems. If you have known of another project this does this, and can find out the details that would likely help.

---

Matt's opinion near the end of thread was:
'At the end of the day, you probably don't want fully automatic upgrading as you don't know if the "stable" release of 2.1 (or 2.0) is going to break something you have.

My best guess would be a well-scripted way to SVN SWITCH several installs would be the safest.'

item.title: Ticket #3595 (Links and link categories not filtered by get_links_list) created
item.dc:creator: jhodgdon
item.description:
When you make a list of links (or blogroll) in your sidebar using the get_links_list function, neither the link category names nor the links themselves are run through a filter. It would be very helpful if they were filtered, so that plugins could modify the text displayed.

For instance, the Polyglot plugin filters regular category names, so you can make them bilingual. But link names and link categories are not filtered in the same way.

I suggest creating filters called: link_category, link_title, link_description

I will attach some patches to implement this...

item.description: The new geeklog.php adds the time and memory limits to the code, and also inserts the story ID from geeklog into a _gl_sid key in the postmeta table. item.title: Ticket #3593 (Add stable tag to SVN) created
item.dc:creator: dustyakubra
item.description:
​Updating wordpress via svn is ​the hip thing to do these days (because it's about a million times easier than the usual way.) However, the guides I've seen so far all tell users to use wordpress trunk, and that's just stupid!

$ svn switch ​http://svn.automattic.com/wordpress/tags/2.0.7

is far longer than

$ svn up

so convincing users to do that would be difficult. What I would suggest is a "stable" svn tag - or you could call it "release" or whatever, but basically after implementing that, we can contact the authors of guides on using SVN to update Wordpress and encourage them to change to using the stable tag.

item.title: Changeset [4746]: Revert [4743]. Not needed.
item.dc:creator: ryan
item.description: Revert [4743]. Not needed.

item.title: Ticket #3592 (Links added in RTE with double-quotes fail to validate) created
item.dc:creator: irayo
item.description:
If I add a hyperlink that has a link description that contains quotes, then the following invalid HTML is generated:

<a title=" a "quote" in the description " href...>

This fails to validate, and furthermore could theoretically (I haven't tried) be used as a security exploit to gain access to other HTML elements:

<a title=" "><othertag><a title=" " href...>

This has been tested in WordPress 2.0.7.

item.title: patch.diff attached to Ticket #3591
item.dc:creator: donncha

item.title: Ticket #3591 (Cat ID filter must go at the end of insert_category()) created
item.dc:creator: donncha
item.description:
Unfortunately the cat_ID filter must go at the end of insert_category(). In discussion on the previous patch, #3458, the filter was moved above the other filters, but that doesn't work.

I've attached a patch that moves the appropriate code to the end of the function.

item.title: Ticket #3579 (Managing a page with doc attachment RTE does not load) updated
item.dc:creator: ricbax
item.description:
I am using 2.06 and I am not to sure if it was happening in previous versions because I haven't required the feature until recently.

I am using it for a downloadable Microsoft Word document not an image file. This happens when managing both Posts and Pages.

If I click one of the tabs Upload / Browse / Browse All it no longer hangs and displays the visual editor instead of the HTML with the hourglass/pointer.

I am guessing a refresh problem with the tinymce?

item.title: Ticket #3569 (XHTML compatibility problem with Safari) updated
item.dc:creator: nickshanks
item.description:
Keywords changed

Added a new patch. This also changes uarr/darr/larr/rarr to NCRs, and converts the two files wp-content/themes/default/functions.php and wp-includes/js/tinymce/plugins/paste/editor_plugin.js to UNIX line endings so that patch(1) can apply diffs. These files will look odd in trac's diff viewer.

item.description: Cc, Keywords, Version changed

item.title: i18n-admin-username.diff attached to Ticket #3589
item.dc:creator: nbachiyski

item.title: Ticket #3589 (admin username could be translated) created
item.dc:creator: nbachiyski
item.description: The administrative user name is internationalized, so it can contain non-ASCII characters. However, it goes through sanitize_user in strict mode, which allows only ASCII characters and thus the newly installed blog becomes unusable.

item.title: Ticket #3569 (XHTML compatibility problem with Safari) updated
item.dc:creator: nickshanks
item.description:
Note that if you view the diff with trac, the file wp-content/themes/default/functions.php will only show a remove line. That file has DOS line endings, unlike all the others, and SVN produces a diff file with alternating empty lines, which trac seems unable to handle.

I would like to see this fix get into 2.1 si possis.

item.dc:creator: nickshanks
item.description: Proposesd fix

item.title: Ticket #3588 (Bug with Thumbnail Creation) created
item.dc:creator: ryanfitzer
item.description:
I'm getting a bug in 2.0.7 (I've seen it in earlier versions as well) where the inline uploading process creates different sized thumbnails depending on the image's ratio and/or file size.

Example:
Uploaded an image 1152px wide by 864px tall and WP generated a thumb that was 128px wide by 96px tall.
Uploaded another image that was 576px by 479px and WP generated a thumb that was 96px wide by 73px tall.
Then resized image 2 to be 600px wide by 450px tall and WP generated a thumb that was 128px wide by 96px tall.

item.title: Ticket #3586 (wp_list_categories() incorrectly uses list_cats filter) created
item.dc:creator: markjaquith
item.description:
The list_cats filter is for filtering the text of individual categories, not for filtering the output of wp_list_categories(). Having one filter do double duty is really confusing.

Suggest wp_list_categories filter for filtering wp_list_categories() output.

item.title: Ticket #3581 (Comment code) updated
item.dc:creator: jplourde
item.description:
Replying to markjaquith:

Please quantify "inability to comment." What happens when you try? Are you sure the comments aren't being caught in moderation?

A page comes up saying it cannot be found, for example, go to the blog <​http://www.thejoshdesign.com/blog>

I've set up a trial account. uname India pword 1234 ..level is contributor. When you go to comment on the first article, you get the address ​http://thejoshdesign.com/blog/archives/23#respond but nothing shows up, page cannot be found, etc.

You'll also notice if you try to navigate via categories, you get a similar product.

item.title: Ticket #3584 (Quicktags should be conditionalised on html_type == text/html) updated
item.dc:creator: foolswisdom
item.description: Milestone changed

item.title: Ticket #3584 (Quicktags should be conditionalised on html_type == text/html) updated
item.dc:creator: nickshanks
item.description: Summary changed

item.title: Ticket #3584 (Quicktags should be conditionalised on html_type == text/html) created
item.dc:creator: nickshanks
item.description:
The edToolbar() function called from admin-functions.php:1127 (and included in post and new-page when accessed) calls the document.write() function, which isn't allowed in XHTML, causing much breakage of the site as I cannot post new content!

Recommend wrapping the_quicktags() function with a check for option_html_type == "text/html", and if not equal, do not include quicktags.

item.description: why did it delete my carriage returns?

item.title: Ticket #3580 (wordpress.org/download meaning of "F5" not clear) created
item.dc:creator: nickshanks
item.description:
wordpress.org/download meaning of "F5" not clear 

nickshanks: on wordpress.org/download it says "Press F5 to reload and get a new styling"
MarkJaquith: nickshanks: browsers cache CSS
nickshanks: MarkJaquith: but WordPress aren't going to know what F5 does
MarkJaquith: nickshanks: ah, good point.  Guess it assumes that people who don't know how to refresh their browser are IE users ;-)
nickshanks: MarkJaquith: ahh. don't know about IE things, i haven't got it
nickshanks: MarkJaquith: perhaps better put "Clear your browser cache (F5 for Windows IE users)"

item.title: Ticket #3576 (Stopping anarchy in plugins' menus) updated
item.dc:creator: PozHonks
item.description:
OK, I start.

1- Most third party plugins menu should "dwell" in Plugins sub-menu, by default, for example, it offers new administration functions, a tweak to enhance WordPress, adding a new possibility in posts (i.e.: adhesive, google sitemap, related post, WordPress Database Backup, rss syndication, contact-form, mailing list manager, spell checker, translator, advanced search, etc.)

2- A third party plugins menu may be found in Manage menu only if it really enhances Posts, Pages, and Comments (i.e.: antispam plugins, UTW ).

3- A third party plugins menu may be found in Options menu when they are really improving WordPress behavior in general (i.e.: WP-cache), not a simple option or function, those should go to the main Plugins menu.

The only problem is to manage developer's ego because they all invent something that really improves WP, but at the end, and after 20 plugins, alters the ease of use of the admin area.
So, we need to find a good definition of what is really and what is not so really !!

item.title: Ticket #3579 (Managing a page with doc attachment RTE does not load) updated
item.dc:creator: foolswisdom
item.description:
Keywords changed

Hi Rick,

Thank you for participating in WordPress!

I have not been able to reproduce this problem using WordPress 2.0.7 nor trunk.

Was this previously working for you? With what version of WordPress?

Have you found this only is problem with pages not with posts?

The Upload section of the UI is on Upload / Browse or Browse All?

Please provide the steps that you used to recreate this problem. ?

I tried a view different ways, but here is the steps I understood from your desc:

  1. Write Page
  2. Upload Image
  3. Create New Page
  4. Manage Page , Edit the new page
  5. Click "Save and Continue Editing"

ACTUAL RESULT
As expected. The page refreshes and I am able to continue editing the page

item.title: Ticket #3576 (Stopping anarchy in plugins' menus) updated
item.dc:creator: PozHonks
item.description: I was talking about ease of use and giving clearer rules or guidelines that third party developers should follow. Not restricting anything and break all existing plugins. That's all.

item.title: Ticket #3576 (Stopping anarchy in plugins' menus) updated
item.dc:creator: ketsugi
item.description:
UTW has multiple plugin pages for a reason. Options>Tags sets UTW plugin options, while Manage>Tags lets you manage the tag data that UTW provides access to.

Similarly, I have an Acronyms plugin that requires no options, but has a Manage>Acronyms page to let the user manage the data that the plugin uses.

I agree that better guidelines should be provided (When to use Options? When to use Manage? When to put it under the Dashboard? When to create a plugin top-level category? etc) but this freedom should not be removed. Let developers make the decision.

Better yet, let the user have final control over where the menus go, but this would be a separate ticket and would likely break a lot of existing plugins in the process of implementing.
